intro: Anthospermum nodosum, commonly known as the clustered anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and its stems are often woody and branched. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
